resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
pitrou commented on pull request #6356: ARROW-7754: [C++] Make Result<> faster
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6356
 
 
   The main culprit for slowness was the underlying variant<> implementation.
   
   The new implementation has comparable speed to returning Status + passing
   a result-out pointer parameter.

pitrou commented on issue #6356: ARROW-7754: [C++] Make Result<> faster
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6356#issuecomment-582366979
 
 
   Benchmarks with gcc 7.4.
   Before:
   ```
   ErrorSchemeNoError                 6639 ns         6639 ns       317032 items_per_second=903.797M/s
   ErrorSchemeBool                    6671 ns         6670 ns       315067 items_per_second=899.551M/s
   ErrorSchemeStatus                  6691 ns         6690 ns       315033 items_per_second=896.894M/s
   ErrorSchemeResult                 17563 ns        17561 ns       119493 items_per_second=341.658M/s
   ErrorSchemeException               6661 ns         6660 ns       314578 items_per_second=900.89M/s
   ErrorSchemeNoErrorNoInline         8055 ns         8054 ns       261182 items_per_second=745.009M/s
   ErrorSchemeBoolNoInline            6966 ns         6965 ns       301415 items_per_second=861.476M/s
   ErrorSchemeStatusNoInline         16561 ns        16558 ns       124946 items_per_second=362.354M/s
   ErrorSchemeResultNoInline         26487 ns        26484 ns        79153 items_per_second=226.553M/s
   ErrorSchemeExceptionNoInline       6713 ns         6713 ns       312970 items_per_second=893.829M/s
   ```
   After:
   ```
   ErrorSchemeNoError                 6625 ns         6624 ns       318577 items_per_second=905.814M/s
   ErrorSchemeBool                    6627 ns         6626 ns       317117 items_per_second=905.542M/s
   ErrorSchemeStatus                  6618 ns         6617 ns       317080 items_per_second=906.801M/s
   ErrorSchemeResult                  6679 ns         6678 ns       315035 items_per_second=898.482M/s
   ErrorSchemeException               6619 ns         6618 ns       317465 items_per_second=906.599M/s
   ErrorSchemeNoErrorNoInline         7990 ns         7988 ns       261371 items_per_second=751.097M/s
   ErrorSchemeBoolNoInline            6934 ns         6933 ns       303121 items_per_second=865.388M/s
   ErrorSchemeStatusNoInline         16428 ns        16426 ns       127358 items_per_second=365.283M/s

   ErrorSchemeExceptionNoInline       7980 ns         7979 ns       263240 items_per_second=751.949M/s
   ```

pitrou commented on issue #6356: ARROW-7754: [C++] Make Result<> faster
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6356#issuecomment-582368891
 
 
   Benchmarks with clang 9.0.
   Before:
   ```
   ErrorSchemeNoError                 7201 ns         7200 ns       292201 items_per_second=833.287M/s
   ErrorSchemeBool                    7270 ns         7269 ns       289349 items_per_second=825.452M/s
   ErrorSchemeStatus                  6888 ns         6887 ns       303353 items_per_second=871.182M/s
   ErrorSchemeResult                 48606 ns        48600 ns        43180 items_per_second=123.456M/s
   ErrorSchemeException               7675 ns         7674 ns       273419 items_per_second=781.85M/s
   ErrorSchemeNoErrorNoInline         8031 ns         8031 ns       261096 items_per_second=747.151M/s
   ErrorSchemeBoolNoInline            7563 ns         7563 ns       278403 items_per_second=793.376M/s
   ErrorSchemeStatusNoInline         16063 ns        16061 ns       130412 items_per_second=373.582M/s
   ErrorSchemeResultNoInline         47883 ns        47878 ns        43879 items_per_second=125.319M/s
   ErrorSchemeExceptionNoInline       7396 ns         7395 ns       283828 items_per_second=811.316M/s
   ```
   After:
   ```
   ErrorSchemeNoError                 7145 ns         7145 ns       294524 items_per_second=839.806M/s
   ErrorSchemeBool                    7565 ns         7564 ns       277756 items_per_second=793.21M/s
   ErrorSchemeStatus                  7094 ns         7093 ns       296323 items_per_second=845.898M/s
   ErrorSchemeResult                 17428 ns        17424 ns       120180 items_per_second=344.344M/s
   ErrorSchemeException               7606 ns         7605 ns       276110 items_per_second=788.972M/s
   ErrorSchemeNoErrorNoInline         6631 ns         6630 ns       316267 items_per_second=904.932M/s
   ErrorSchemeBoolNoInline            9286 ns         9285 ns       225941 items_per_second=646.179M/s
   ErrorSchemeStatusNoInline         15925 ns        15923 ns       131750 items_per_second=376.802M/s
   ErrorSchemeResultNoInline         17424 ns        17421 ns       120060 items_per_second=344.403M/s
   ErrorSchemeExceptionNoInline       9358 ns         9357 ns       223584 items_per_second=641.213M/s
   ```
   
   (for some reason, clang refuses to inline the `Result`-returning function...)

fsaintjacques commented on pull request #6356: ARROW-7754: [C++] Make Result<> faster
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6356#discussion_r375824537
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/result.h
 ##########
 @@ -192,14 +207,27 @@ class Result : public util::EqualityComparable<Result<T>> {
   template <typename U, typename E = typename std::enable_if<
                             std::is_constructible<T, const U&>::value &&
                             std::is_convertible<U, T>::value>::type>
-  Result(const Result<U>& other) : variant_("unitialized") {
-    AssignVariant(other.variant_);
+  Result(const Result<U>& other) : status_(other.status_) {
 
 Review comment:
   Does this cover the previous copy-constructor, e.g. if `U = T`?

fsaintjacques commented on pull request #6356: ARROW-7754: [C++] Make Result<> faster
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6356#discussion_r375828256
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/result.h
 ##########
 @@ -212,9 +240,15 @@ class Result : public util::EqualityComparable<Result<T>> {
   template <typename U,
             typename E = typename std::enable_if<std::is_constructible<T, U&&>::value &&
                                                  std::is_convertible<U, T>::value>::type>
-  Result(Result<U>&& other) : variant_("unitialized") {
-    AssignVariant(std::move(other.variant_));
-    other.variant_ = "Value was moved to another Result.";
+  Result(Result<U>&& other) noexcept {
+    if (ARROW_PREDICT_TRUE(other.status_.ok())) {
 
 Review comment:
   Can you just:
   ```c++
   std::swap(status_, other.status_);
   std::swap(data_, other.data_);
   ```
   That would remove the destructor crash issue.

   I have tried using `__attribute__((always_inline))` and also passing `-mllvm -inline-threshold=10000`, and clang still doesn't seem to inline that `Result`-returning function. There is definitely something it chokes on.
   
   It may actually be worthwhile trying to make a reproducer and opening an issue on clang?

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
When converting a short performance-critical function to return a Result (instead of returning a Status and filling a out-parameter), I noticed a catastrophic performance regression (around 2x or 3x slower).

It seems the current Result implementation is very slow, for several reasons:
- it imposes "safety" features even in release mode, for example on the critical path of move operators
- the underlying mpark variant implementation is not optimized for performance-critical data structures

comments.body: This may change the calculus for changing performance-critical methods that currently return Status to use Result cc [~emkornfield]

I'm sorry it is that much slower it is probably due to as Antoine points out to using a variant instead of managing some of the state manually.  May I ask which function it was?

 

I agree performance critical functions probably shouldn't use result (and probably not even status as a return type).
